summary: Internal FBI email chain from August 2019 discussing coordination issues with victim notifications in the Epstein case, specifically regarding discrepancies in victim lists and contact information in the Victim Notification System (VNS). The emails involve FBI personnel and SDNY victim assistance staff working to finalize notifications ahead of a court conference.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Identified as the attorney for a victim who needed to be added to the notification list.

connections.description: Communicating via email to coordinate victim notification efforts and schedule meetings.
Representing at least one victim who needed to be added to the VNS notification list.

events.title: Request to add victim addresses to VNS
events.description: Email exchange about checking VNS and inputting addresses for victims whose profiles lacked them.

events.title: Coordination on victim information entry
events.description: Email confirming intent to enter victim information and send notifications, with plans to meet with case agent.

events.title: Call with SDNY victim assistance
events.description: Call held to review victim list in VNS, noting discrepancies with a previously received spreadsheet.

events.title: Follow-up on victim list discrepancies
events.description: Email offering to discuss best way to fix discrepancies in multiple victim spreadsheets.

keyFacts: Internal FBI emails reveal operational challenges in managing victim notifications for the Epstein case, specifically with discrepancies in victim lists within the Victim Notification System (VNS).
Multiple spreadsheets and victim lists were being compared and corrected, indicating a high volume of victims and potential data management issues.
Communication involved coordination between FBI personnel and SDNY victim assistance staff to ensure accurate victim contact information ahead of a court conference.
Attorney Brad Edwards is identified as representing at least one victim who needed to be added to the notification system.
The emails highlight the procedural efforts to notify victims and update their information in July-August 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest.
